runs.comm: goes a bit away after pitching short of length, pushed to the off side
length ball on middle and leg, tapped towards mid-on for a single
fullish and outside off, spinning away and that is carved through cover for four
flighted half-volley, tossed up generously, and Warner throws the bath tub at it, slogging it between the umpire and mid-on
the one that come in, Warner reads it off the pitch, but keeps it out
another slider, Warner gets an inside edge onto the pad, but all is safe
Sharma scored one run and has conceded two already. Pushed to cover, where Sharma doesn't go down, doesn't get behind the ball, and lets it through
big wide outside off, Watson tries to hit it, but can't
length ball, on off, pushed back to him
shaping in slightly, driven on the up, but straight to mid-off
short of a length, just outside off, angling away, beats his dab
length ball, on off, driven on the up, just to the left of Chawla, and they steal a single. Not many fielders would allow that
short of a length, gets the width, goes hard at it, gets a bottom edge into the pitch
offbreak, middle and off, flicked away past midwicket for one
pauses and delivers, turns it into the pads, pushed to square leg
another pause before delivering, Warner backs away to punch a flat delivery, but straight to cover
angling in again, inside edge onto the pad
incredible shot. Makes room to this delivery angling, takes it from well outside leg, and punches it between two cover fieldsmen. Chawla's chase allows an easy three
sweeps, sweeps fine, but straight to short fine
another incredible shot. All hands and wrists. Short of a lenght, no room, and he has punched it away past point. All the power coming in through the wrists
length ball, on off, shaping away a little, draws respect from Warner
walks down to Zaheer Khan who digs it in at 131ks and hits him in the ribs. No show of pain
short of a length, 135ks, kicks at him, takes the shoulder of the bat, but it's wide enough of point
short of a length, defended
big lbw shout, but this is not swinging at all and is pitched at least a foot outside the line of leg
paused and delivers a flat wide down the leg side
makes room and pulls a dart to deep midwicket
the carrom ball, length ball, on leg, straightens, punched to straight midwicket
long hop outside leg, and there is no hope if you bowl that to Watson. He has pulled it over square leg. Doesn't matter if it is a carrom ball or a chess ball if you bowl that short
presses forward, goes deep into the crease to pull this, but finds midwicket
carrom ball outside off, late-cut past slip, gets a couple
this is a bit of rubbish from Ashwin. Another long hop, into the pads, and Watson has deposited it over midwicket
short, wide, gentle pace, and he has punched it between cover and cover-point. An over too many for Zaheer?

huge shout, and he looked dead. Length ball, just outside off, skidding on, hits him in front of middle and leg. That was close, but Umpire Kettleborough thought it was headed down, but replays show he was dead. Kohli is not happy, and lets it be known through a popular Indian expletive
length ball on off, defended back to him
length ball, outside off, and he has driven this with an open face, and over point. India running away with it
fuller, middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
another huge lbw shout, but without any swing this has to have pitched well outside leg. Zaheer doesn't find it amusing, though
length ball, outside ff, punched away to sweeper-cover
flighted outside off, pretty slow through the air, defended well
drags this short, Watson ricks back and pulls this to deep midwicket along the ground
short again, 87ks, Warner rocks back too, and pulls this smack between long-on and deep midwicket
flighted this time, on off, defended with an open face
this one doesn't turn after pitching off, hits the inside half of the bat
welcome to the crease. You may as well give the red rag to a bull. Long hop, middle and leg, to Watson. Need I mention what happened after that?
not-turning legbreak, cut away to deep point
non-turner again, pitched on leg, defended off the back foot
slides with the angle again, cut away to deep cover
slider, well bowled, accurate, Watson stays back to defend
wide half-volley, Watson is not going to respect them. Slog-sweeps it dead straight for a flat six
flighted, 85ks, pitches outside leg, beats his drive
that's a bull-headed shot. Flighted outside off, played against the turn, mis-hit slightly, but he has enough power and bat behind it to clear deep midwicket
if mis-hits are flying for sixes, imagine when he hits them clean. It goes deep towards the end of the stadium. This is carnage
Harbhajan's most threatening delivery. The tppie that slides into the left-hand batsman. He got Morgan that way, but Warner gets his bat down in time
only slightly short, but Watson rocks back to pull this away
short of a length, on off, gets a bottom edge on the cut
length ball, on middle and leg, angling towards off, defended back to him
that's into the third tier. Irfan is not even quarter the bowler with the old ball. why would you not give him the new swinging ball? This is short and a sitting duck. Don't bowl this to Watson
"Ridiculous bowling," says Mark Waugh, but hang on that has only gone into the second tier. Short again, and Watson is not going to let you get away with this
oh he has angled this well down leg with fine leg up. It's gone past that man for his fifty
late-cuts this for a couple, fine of third man
late-cuts again, and keeps strike
full, on off, inside edge into the pad
slow, legbreak, defended again
full toss, on the pads, driven to long-on
slow through the air again, defended solidly
beautiful shot. Nothing brutal about it. Full, middle and leg, and he has lofted this dead straight. Just a caress
short of a length, hurrying onto him, pushed towards long-on, and they steal the second
slow, very slow, and has he dropped it? Yes he has. Warner went to cut it hard, edged it, but it didn't stick in. Dhoni is not getting anything right here
tries the slog-sweep, but is beaten
flighted outside off, pushed to extra cover
flat outside off, punched to deep cover
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for a quiet little single
short of a length, pulled away, gets a couple wide of long-on
slog-sweeps this flat, and well short of deep midwicket
three more runs gifted by Chawla. Short of a length, on off, punched to extra cover, and it hits Chawla's hand and ricochets to wide of long-off
Watson has missed out on a six. Full toss, on the pads, mis-hits the slog-sweep, gets just a single
fifty for Warner too, with a punch down to long-off. He has heard a bit from Indian fielders, and is pretty satisfied with his effort. No Indian fielder near him now
full, on the pads, smacked away with a flick of the wrists, and it keeps travelling, beating deep midwicket
It might well be. He starts with a buffet full toss, and Warner has cleared deep midwicket with ease
that's insult to injury. Yuvraj gets another edge, past keeper, through vacant slip region

Yuvraj gets a wicket. Short of a length, Watson punches it, straight to Tiwary at short extra cover. Good for Tiwary, who finally gets to enter the field, if only as a substitute, and takes a catch immediately
flighted, full toss, driven to long-on
wide half-volley, slog-swept over midwicket. One shot away now
India will at least bowl another over. Yuvraj ensures it with a quicker flatter delivery, which Warner punches straight to extra cover
Ashwin finally gets an edge with a carrom ball, but it falls short of slip
offbreak now, off and middle, defended back
carrom ball, wide outside off, punched to sweeper-cover
slower now, flighted on off, defended to leg
fitting end to the match. Zaheer at cover dives on this like London Bridge falling down, and lets it through for four
